definition: to do everything one can/to spare no effort/to strive

sentences.english: The sea in the sails, call your motivate you struggled to climb the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 大海在召喚你揚帆遠航，高山在激勵你奮力攀登。

sentences.english: Workers do all they can to fulfill the production quota.
sentences.chinese: 工人們奮力實現生產指標。

sentences.english: I struggled to steady the large vase.
For the protection of ZhongLiang blood, shaolin the monk would die rather than surrender, strive to resist.
sentences.chinese: 爲保護忠良的血脈，少林衆僧寧死不屈，奮力抵抗。

sentences.english: Would gush, flush, green these mountains and these valleys.
sentences.chinese: 將奮力噴出，沖刷滌盪，灌綠青山和這些山谷。

sentences.english: Nahti walked toward the bed, and Marcus jumped toward the door, struggling with the doorknob.
sentences.chinese: 娜蒂向牀走去，馬庫斯則向門跳去，奮力的扭門把手。

sentences.english: In July 1768 the Endeavour set out for the Pacific.
sentences.chinese: 1768年七月“奮力號”啓程開赴太平洋。

sentences.english: He struck out across the river.
I hauled upon his hand and made him off the cliff.
sentences.chinese: 我奮力拉住他的一隻手，把他從懸崖邊上拉了回來。

sentences.english: He strained and raised the barbell of 205 kilograms.
sentences.chinese: 他奮力一舉，舉起了205公斤重的槓鈴。

sentences.english: I struggled to sum up the confusing exchange.
sentences.chinese: 我奮力總結出這個令人困惑的交換條件。

sentences.english: He struggled to the surface as the water dragged him down.
sentences.chinese: 水把他往下卷，他奮力掙扎到水面上來。

sentences.english: On the ceiling one can see roots of some trees which somehow managed to get here through the stone.
sentences.chinese: 在洞頂人們可以看到一些奮力從石縫中長出的樹。

sentences.english: As he strolled along the beach, he threw the clay balls into the ocean as far as he could.
sentences.chinese: 沿着海岸漫步時，他奮力將那些泥球一個個扔進大海。

sentences.english: If the leopard seal loses its grip, the penguin will make a break for it.
sentences.chinese: 如果斑海豹鬆開口，企鵝就會奮力逃生。

definition: to make a supreme effort/at all costs
to pursue/to chase after/to accelerate/to catch up with/to overtake
to throw off/to struggle free of/Taiwan pr. [zheng1 tuo1]
to go forward/to forge ahead/to advance/onward
to resist/to make a stand and fight (against)
to fight bravely/(fig.) to struggle/to work hard
to see with one's own eyes/very soon
